name: polyester fibre production, finished | fibre, polyester | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20707/documentation

The dataset covers polyester production, using polyethylene terephthalate (PET) granulate as input by the melt spinning process.;For the melt spinning process, Fully Oriented Yarn (FOY) spinning is considered. Specific data are used for the production of staple fibres.;Polyester production and melt spinning processes are based on global data. These processes are modelled according to general data which are adapted to the electricity mix. The global electricity mix is developed based on main polyester staple fibres producing countries global statistics. The inventory takes into account the required amount of inputs to produce 1kg of polyester fibres. The dataset includes electricity, heat, water and materials needed for the production. Air and water emissions are included as elementary flows.;; ;Textile waste generated during spinning is recycled back into production.;; The recycled amount corresponds to 3.5% of the input PET granulate. Electrcity and heat were adjusted accordingly (+3.5%). ;The estimated water incorporation into the product is 1.5%. ;Missing sum parameters to water (DOC, TOC).

The activity starts with the provision of PET material.

The activity ends after the melt-spinning FOY (Fully Oriented Yarn) (production of PES fibres).
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/203:Manufacture of man-made fibres/2030:Manufacture of man-made fibres

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data for the production of polyester granulates date from 2003. Data for the melt spinning process date from 2001 and 2013. Data for wastewater treatment are from 2004 and 2007. Statistical data used for raw material production location date back to 2009.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The geographical representativeness of the dataset covers the global production of polyester staple fibres (granulate production and melt spinning process).
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The dataset covers 100% of the production based on an extrapolation of 90% of the most representative supply chains. Polyester granulate production and the melt spinning process are modelled according to general data.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data come from several sources: publications, literature and surveys conducted by companies.

exchanges.description: Value comes from polyester production - Electricity is modelled based on the main countries of polyester fibres production. Electricity consumption was scaled by additionally 3.5% to include a recirculation of waste polyester. During the production 3.5% of the input is generated as waste (0.035 kg). From the latter value 0.020 kg are succesfully recirculated whilst 0.015 kg end up as waste plastic.

exchanges.description:
DOC and TOC are assumed to be equal in the case of a filtered sample. It is further estimated as a general rule of thumb that COD=2.7*TOC. All above info are documented in the Data Quality Guidelines of ecoinvent version 3. 

Reference: 
Weidema B P, Bauer C, Hischier R, Mutel C, Nemecek T, Reinhard J, Vadenbo C O, Wernet G. (2013). Overview and methodology. Data quality guideline for the ecoinvent database version 3. Ecoinvent Report 1(v3). St. Gallen: The ecoinvent Centre
